#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Secretary of Defense Hagel 's presence , along with Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff General Martin Dempsey , shows the commitment of the United States to support its ally .
#Text=The United States remains committed to the transfer of operational control ( OPCON ) to the South Koreans for general defense of South Korea .
#Text=The US is also strongly committed to limiting proliferation of nuclear , chemical , and biological weapons .
#Text=Their presence reinforces that to the North Koreans as well as to the international community .
#Text=It is simple routine in the USA – ROK alliance .
#Text=South Koreans depend on it and the US takes care to show support .
#Text=Yes , it further showcases the depth of Washington 's support for South Korea against any provocation from Pyongyang .
#Text=Certainly he is there to add symbolic strength to the alliance which tended to be weakened until recently .
#Text=Behind his presence is the recent agreement to reconsider the planed transfer of the war-time operation control from the UN /US to the Korean army .

#Text=US – South Korea alliance is strong but it is a bit more complicated since [ the ] US is supporting Japan in arming in naval forces to check China , which is a great concern for South Korea and [ the ] South Korean people .
#Text=This might cause some issues in US – South Korea alliance .
#Text=File photo of interviewee Gari Ledyard .
#Text=Image : Gari Ledyard .
#Text=North Korea 's rhetoric vows the repeated bolstering of its nuclear arsenal to what it calls US military threats .
#Text=Do you think a military parade of this type backed by the US is likely to influence further hostility ?
#Text=No , because NK must be permanently hostile toward the US and SK anyway .

#Text=NK has no reason to exist as a separate , poorer Korean state , just as the GDR [ East Germany ] had no post- cold war reason to exist , unless SK and the US can be regularly described as the enemy .
#Text=So NK does n't want a war , but they certainly do n't want a warm peace , as then NK then loses its raison d'etre .
#Text=No , North Korea and its leadership are responsible for its choices , which are the primary source of instability on the Korean peninsula with potential regional effects .
#Text=The " military threats " are more a reflection of North Korea 's fears than any concrete threats .
#Text=They are more for internal DPRK [ North Korea ] efforts to keep its own population in tune with government policies .

#Text=No. I think it 's important to remember Pyongyang 's periodic provocations and its pursuit of nuclear arsenal are not reactions or self-defense measures against a threatening Seoul or Washington .
#Text=Incapable of competing with economically flourishing South Korea , the North relies on bolstering its nuclear arsenal and on military and political brinkmanship to make up ground .
